title: Rogue Panda Updates the Alamo Top Tube Bag with More Secure Attachment System
content:
Rogue Panda has overhauled its Alamo Top Tube Bag with a more rigid structure, one-handed zipper access, and sturdy attachments. Let’s check it out…

The Flagstaff, Arizona-based bicycle portage brand makes every Alamo to order in one of three sizes – the Regular, the Gordo, and the extra-long Gordito Grande.

New Attachments: The Alamo has a new combined attachment system, with bolts and straps available on every bag. Click here for instructions to see how it works.

The straps now attach using specially shaped TPU spacers and an integrated stiffener plate. The new system is so stable that the front strap is no longer needed! The spacers are designed to fit snugly on round and flat top tubes.

Rogue Panda also includes bolt holes in the bag and stiffener, so if your frame bag has bolts you can use those instead. The default locations are compatible with frames that have their first bolt between 2.75″ and 4.5″ from the back of the stem, which is 99% of frames. But if yours has a different spacing, you can order custom attachments to match!

Design Features:

NEW – Combined strap-bolt attachment system
Molded-tooth zippers for maximum durability!
HDPE Side Panels for structure
Full-length zipper for maximum opening size
Cable port for charging electronics

Specs:

Regular 0.9 liters, 5 oz
Gordo 1.5 liters, 6 oz
Gordito Grande 2.5 liters, 7 oz

The Alamo Top Tube Bags are made to order. Check out more at Rogue Panda. If you do order one, tell ’em we sent ya!
